Vitiscore.hero_title: VitiScore: the reference indicator to assess and manage the phytosanitary footprint of vineyard treatments.
Vitiscore.hero_subtitle: Serving human health, biodiversity and water.
Vitiscore.hero_context: Over 1,000 spray programmes analysed (France, England, Argentina) to compare, decide and improve.
Vitiscore.hero_cta_analyze: Request an analysis of my vineyard
Vitiscore.what_intro: VitiScore is a composite score that combines two complementary dimensions of risk related to crop protection treatments.
Vitiscore.what_abs_desc: The total amount of risk associated with all applied treatments, used to visualise the overall impact of a season.
Vitiscore.what_avg_desc: The average risk level of the products used, reflecting the quality of product choices and protection strategies.
Vitiscore.what_conclusion: This dual perspective highlights both the volume of impact and the quality of choices, guiding credible and measurable action plans. VitiScore also helps minimise climatic and regional effects and makes it easier to compare strategies across regions, climates and countries.
Vitiscore.how_intro: VitiScore is based on AGRITEMIS scientific indicators, which assess pesticide risks on human health, consumers, biodiversity and water.
Vitiscore.indicator_ari_desc: Assesses immediate risks for applicators, workers and nearby residents during treatments.
Vitiscore.indicator_cri_desc: Measures long-term effects of repeated exposure (carcinogenic, endocrine, neurological, etc.).
Vitiscore.indicator_cori_desc: Quantifies the risk through food products and drinking water, including metabolites.
Vitiscore.indicator_bri_desc: Evaluates the impact on bees, birds, earthworms, aquatic organisms and ecosystems.
Vitiscore.indicator_wari_desc: Summarises the risk of groundwater and surface water contamination, for both fauna and consumers.
Vitiscore.analyze_item_1: Your spray programmes: products, doses, frequencies, dates, crops and blocks.
Vitiscore.analyze_item_2: Risk aggregation at plot, farm and group level when multiple estates are involved.
Vitiscore.analyze_item_3: Internal benchmarks (between estates and blocks) and external benchmarks (basins, regions, years).
Vitiscore.analyze_item_4: Identification of reduction levers: substitutions, biocontrol, dose adjustments and strategy optimisation.
Vitiscore.uses_benchmark_desc: Compare practices between estates, regions and countries to identify leaders, gaps and improvement margins.
Vitiscore.uses_strategy_desc: Track the effect of changes (before/after), set vintage targets and manage reduction trajectories.
Vitiscore.uses_kpi_desc: Integrate VitiScore into CSR, purchasing, quality or internal certification dashboards for ongoing monitoring.
Vitiscore.uses_hr_desc: Use VitiScore as an indicator for internal recognition or bonuses linked to environmental performance.
Vitiscore.audience_groups_desc: Multi-estate management, international comparisons and alignment of crop protection strategies at group level.
Vitiscore.audience_domains_desc: Continuous improvement of practices and structured dialogue between technical teams, management and owners.
Vitiscore.audience_interprof_desc: Collective benchmarks, shared reduction pathways and support schemes for members.
Vitiscore.deliverables_item_1: VitiScore at plot and farm level, plus a consolidated group synthesis.
Vitiscore.deliverables_item_2: Risk profile (ARI, CRI, CORI, BRI, WARI) with strengths and points of attention.
Vitiscore.deliverables_item_3: Visual benchmarks (maps, boxplots, radar charts, time series) to compare situations.
Vitiscore.deliverables_item_4: Action plan: alternatives, priority substitutions and reduction targets by season or vintage.
Vitiscore.data_text: More than 1,000 spray programmes have already been analysed (France, England, Argentina), providing robust references to compare your practices. The methodology can be extended to other regions, appellations and countries depending on your projects.
Vitiscore.integrations_item_1: Formats: executive PDF reports, CSV exports and API connections to your information systems, ERPs or farm management software.
Vitiscore.integrations_item_2: Interoperability: possible connection with your existing databases, traceability tools and BI dashboards.
Vitiscore.cta_text: To launch a VitiScore analysis, you upload your spray programmes (CSV/XLSX) and specify your objectives: benchmarking, internal KPIs, communication, bonus schemes, etc. AGRITEMIS provides a quote and, if needed, a sample output on a subset of plots.
Vitiscore.disclaimer_text: VitiScore is a tool developed by AGRITEMIS. It is based on AGRITEMIS indicators (ARI, CRI, CORI, BRI, WARI) and a consolidated, documented and reproducible method.
